Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control and the top-level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> templates.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> to generate the design-time markup.
The methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to a design-time data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.OnClick%2A> method is called when a region of the design-time view of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> is clicked.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> changes.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove or add properties or to shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
Design-time editable regions are not supported in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods have no functionality.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyGridView` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>. The `MyGridView` is simply a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>. The example also derives the `MyGridViewDesigner` class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class and places a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> object for the `MyGridViewDesigner` on the `MyGridView` control.
The `MyGridViewDesigner` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to make the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Page%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid at design time. It overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> property, if it is specified, as a new first row in the `MyGridView` control at design time. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the `MyGridView` control has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.None> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner/CS/gridviewdesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner/VB/gridviewdesigner.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method does the following:
1. Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property of the control to `true`, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> property is empty.
2. Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.DataKeyNames%2A> property of the control to `null`, if the schema of the data source cannot be obtained.
3. Refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called.
4. Calls the base method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time. The example adds a new first row to the grid to contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> property, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> is defined. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> class has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.None> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible. It does not change the run-time appearance of the control.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner/CS/gridviewdesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner/VB/gridviewdesigner.vb#4)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> object of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> property to `false` when the control is in template mode. This is so a column that is in template mode cannot be deleted using the **Fields** dialog box.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> to change the **Properties** grid of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time. The example makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Page%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
